@ak08 Just about anything would be better than Windows 98. But first you should figure out what your hardware is.

Make sure your system meets the minimum requirements for whatever OS you're going to install. 

See here for Win 8 requirements : http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-8/system-requirements

Considering that your computer is out of the 90's and you're obviously not very tech savvy though, it'd probably be best to just get a new computer...

Also, more seeders would be appreciated. Please don't limit your upload speed, upload speed doesn't make much of a difference to your download speed.

@ SecTPB
With a bit of knowledge and research, I have some answers for you.
N: the N means "not with Windows Media Player"
(I think this was something imposed on MicroSoft by the EU)

VL, I think, means Volume Licence: if so, then I don't understand the "VL 64-bit KMS-Activated" option as I thought VL meant it didn't need to be activated??

@ murphy78 Do you have a web page that explains the various variations ;) ?

VL means value licence, and that means that with one key you have right to install windows on many computers, and no that you don't have to activate windows ;)
N means that there is no windows media in specified installation.

@ SecTPB
Install Win8 Enterprise Activated, and if you don't use win media player install N version.
